planning.translation[0].definitions[0].d: the process of thinking about and deciding on a plan for achieving or making something
planning.translation[0].definitions[0].e: A little forward planning (=thinking about how to do something before doing it) can save you a lot of expense.
Good financial planning is vital to business success.
A little careful planning is important in gardening.
‘How did you manage to be so late?’ ‘Just bad planning.’
planning.translation[0].note_box[0].sect: Good planning will ensure the move is as trouble-free as possible.
‘I’ve got no money left.’ ‘That was bad planning.’
To do the job properly requires careful planning.
Success had been achieved through the meticulous planning of their leader.
In order to have a reasonable pension in retirement, forward planning is essential.
Long-term planning centers on ensuring the future growth of the company.
He runs a business that offers companies advice on marketing and strategic planning.
Owing to poor financial planning, I was almost out of money.
planning.translation[1].definitions[0].d: when you think carefully about something you want to do in the future, and decide exactly how you will do it
planning.translation[1].definitions[0].e: If you want to ensure a trouble-free retirement, it’s never too early to start financial planning.
The main planning focus for suppliers will be business planning to enable them to secure and fulfil contracts.
